sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 1, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Arbeit für Schüler.
Von Frl. Elias (Br. durch Boten): Absage.
Mit Lie-Liechen Wege.
An Frl. Elias (K.): Erkundigung.
Diebstahl der Dollar.
Work for pupils.
From Miss Elias (letter via messenger): cancellation.
With Lie-Liechen, errands.
To Miss Elias (postcard): inquiry.
Theft of the dollars.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 2, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Vom Stadtseminar in Freiburg im Breisgau: Programm. Stadtseminar: presumably the courses in music-theoretical and general musical education founded in 1926 by Erich Doflein; see also the diary entry for February 23.

Vom Drei Masken Verlag (Br.): Abrechnung vom 1. VII. – 1. I. 34; Anstieg! Anstieg: by using this word to indicate that his royalty payment is greater than the previous one, Schenker may also be alluding to one of his later technical concepts, the ‘initial ascent’ (a linear progression leading to the primary tone of the Urlinie).
Bamberger von 5–½8h.
Von Frl. Elias (expreß Br.): wird Dienstag kommen.
From the municipal college in Freiburg in Breisgau: program.
From Drei Masken Verlag (letter): account from July 1 1933 to January 1, 1934; increase!
Bamberger from 5 o’clock to 7:30.
From Miss Elias (express letter): she will come on Tuesday.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 3, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Frau Khuner (Br.): wird Mittwoch kommen.
Wege nach der Jause.
From Mrs. Khuner (letter): she will come on Wednesday.
After teatime, errands.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 4, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Jause bei Sacher – Kärntnerstraße – 71er. A streetcar line in Vienna, which has existed since 1907 and runs between the Central Cemetery and the Stock Exchange.
Afternoon snack at the Sacher – Kärntnerstraße – No. 71.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 5, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Nach Tisch: Frobenius-Ausstellung An exhibit organized by the Künstlerbund of Hagen together with the Kulturbund of Vienna that ran in January and February 1934, in which rock paintings from the collection of Leo Frobenius were displayed, together with African sculptures and applied art. : ½3–4h.
After lunch: Frobenius exhibition, 2:30 to 4 o’clock.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 6, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Frau Khuner (Br.): Absage wegen Erkrankung eines Kindes.
Nach der Jause zu Waldheim: eine neue Brille.
From Mrs. Khuner (letter): cancellation on account of the illness of one of her children.
After teatime, to Waldheim: a new pair of glasses.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 7, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Bamberger (K.): Absage an Schurich.
An Weinberger (K.): bestelle die „Syrischen Tänze“ für Jonas.
An Jonas (K.OJ 5/18, 36): Mitteilung davon, wie hat sich Furtwängler betragen?
To Bamberger (postcard): refusal to Schuricht.
To Weinberger (postcard): I order the Syrian Dances for Jonas.
To Jonas (postcardOJ 5/18, 36): communication thereof; how did Furtwängler behave?

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 8, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Frau Aurednizek (Br.): bittet um den Smetana-Aufsatz. Heinrich Schenker, Friedrich Smetana, Die Zukunft 4 (1893), pp. 37–40.
Frl. Elias erscheint wieder zur Stunde; Brünauer versucht Anschluß u. Material zu erlisten, um die Täuschung aufrechtzuerhalten.
Befund: Zucker 0,66, Eiweiß u. Aceton nicht nachweisbar.
From Mrs. Aurednizek (letter): asks for the Smetana article.
Miss Elias appears again for her lesson; Brünauer attempts to obtain connection and material by subterfuge, in order to keep up the deception.
Result: sugar 0.66%, protein and acetone not detectable.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 9, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Salzer u. Wilfort raten von einem Empfehlungsbrief an Kabasta ab (Bambe.).
Nach der Jause Wege.
Der Accumulator ist leer!
Salzer and Wilfort advise against a letter of recommendation to Kabasta (for Bamberger).
After teatime, errands.
The accumulator is empty!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 10, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Rhythmik in Der freie Satz zu Ende!
Nach der Jause Einkauf (6 Hemden für Lie-Liechen).
Bei Waldstein: eine neue Hornfassung.

Frau Mitzi Jansky bringt wirklich die vorgeschossenen S. 103 zurück On September 24, 1933, the Schenkers’ housemaid Paula Juran was admitted to hospital with an abscess; they were obliged to pay 103 shillings in advance for hospitalization costs (see the diary entries for September 24, November 30, and December 20,1933). – erhält dafür S. 10.
"Rhythm" in Free Composition finished!
After teatime, shopping (six blouses for Lie-Liechen).
At Waldstein’s: a new horn eyeglass frame.
Mrs. Mitzi Jansky actually comes back with the 103 shillings paid in advance – for this she receives 10 shillings.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 11, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Jause bei Sacher, kleiner Spaziergang.
Afternoon snack at the Sacher, short walk.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 12, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Halberstam (Br. u. 2 Befunde): Einladung.

An Floriz
(K.OJ 8/5, [28]): nun zur „Form“ in Der freie Satz.

Revolution!!! (in Heineleins Skizze kein Wort darüber!!) The February Uprising of 1934. Differences between the Social Democrats and the Republikanischer Schutzbund (prohibited in 1933) on one side, and the ruling Christian-Social Party and nationalist paramilitary groups on the other, escalated between February 12 and 15, 1934, into civil war. Social Democratic members of the Schutzbund (under Richard Bernaschek) resisted a weapons raid with armed force conducted by the paramilitary Heimwehr (acting as law-enforcement agents) in the party headquarters of the Social Democrats in Linz.
To Halberstam (letter and two results): invitation.

To Floriz
(postcardOJ 8/5, [28]): now on to "Form" in Free Composition.
Revolution!!! (in Heinelein’s sketch, not a word about it!!)

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 13, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Dr. Frühmann stellt bei Lie-Liechen eine Ciste fest – findet mich wie vor 10 Jahren.
Dr. Frühmann finds a cyst in Lie-Liechen – he finds me the same as I was ten years ago.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 14, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Frau Aurednižek (Br.): werde aus Leipzig die Daten des Aufsatzes Heinrich Schenker, Friedrich Smetana, Die Zukunft 4 (1893), pp. 37–40. erbitten.
An Oppel (Br.): wegen Smetana – Zukunft. See fn.1
Von Salzer (Br.): nicht an Kabasta schreiben.
Von Dr. Rosenthal (K.): Einladung zu einem Konzert.
Um 6h – wir warten schon eine Stunde auf Frau Khuner – fragt Lie-Liechen telephonisch an: „Es tut mir leid, habe um 11h express abgesagt“! Wir verloren den Ausgang, Zeit, Mühe, Geld.
To Mrs. Aurednižek (letter): I shall request the date of the article from Leipzig.
To Oppel (letter): concerning the Smetana article in Die Zukunft.
From Salzer (letter): do not write to Kabasta.
From Dr. Rosenthal (postcard): invitation to a concert.

At 6 o’clock – we have been waiting already for an hour for Mrs. Khuner – Lie-Liechen inquires by telephone: "I am sorry, I cancelled by express letter at 11 o’clock"! We lost the outcome, time, effort, money.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 15, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Khuner (Br. zu wenig frankirt, 50 statt 54 gr.): wird sich melden.

Abends im Rundfunk eine vortreffliche Zusammenfassung der Bedeutung des Sieges über die Austro-Marxisten als ein europäisches Ereignis! The differences between the Social Democrats and the Republican Defense Force (prohibited in 1933) on one side, and the ruling Christian-Social party and nationalist paramilitary groups on the other, escalated between February 12 and 15 into civil war, the February Uprising of 1934. The uprisings in factory workers’ barracks and council houses were crushed by military force. As a result of the uprisings, the Social Democratic Party, trade unions and all representative bodies led by the Social Democrats on the municipal and provincial level were banned, and the May Constitution of 1934 was declared, establishing a corporate state. M. E. wird wird er einmal dem Sieg Prinz Eugens über die Türken gleichgestellt werden!
From Khuner (letter with insufficient postage: 50 groschen, instead of 54): she will get in touch.

In the evening on the radio, an excellent summary of the significance of the victory over the Austrian Marxists, as a European event! In my view it will be placed on the same level as Prince Eugene’s victory over the Turks!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 16, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Sophie (Br.): über des Gatten Befinden.
Von der U.-E. Abrechnung: S. 82.04; Brahms 47 Ex. Johannes Brahms, Oktaven und Quinten u. a., ed. Heinrich Schenker (Vienna: Universal-Edition, 1933). u. ein Band – Harmonielehre!!
Auf telephonischem Wege über Deutsch meldet sich Frau van Hoboken! Lie-Liechen bittet sie für Mmorgen zur Jause.
Spiele den Seminaristen zwei Stücke aus den Händel-Suiten vor.
Nach der Jause bei Fritz.
Von Oppel (K.): gibt die Nummer der „Zukunft“ an. That is, the issue containing Schenker’s article Friedrich Smetana, Die Zukunft 4 (1893), pp. 37–40.
From Sophie (letter): concerning her husband’s health.
From UE, account: 82.04 shillings; 47 copies of Brahms, and one volume – Theory of Harmony!!
Via a telephone call to Deutsch, Mrs. van Hoboken gets in touch! Lie-Liechen invites her for afternoon snack tomorrow.
I play two movements from suites by Handel to the members of my seminar.
After teatime, at Fritz’s.
From Oppel (postcard): he provides the relevant issue of Die Zukunft.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 17, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Frau Auredniček (expreß Br.): gebe Oppels Angabe weiter!
Von der Steuerbehörde: Steuermandat für 1932!
Von Rinn (Br.): Krise aller Zeitschriften – Zurückstellung (!?).
Von der U.-E. (Br.): bitten Dr. Roth u. Kapellmeister Stein Dienstag zu empfangen.
Von 5–¾7h Frau van Hoboken: anscheinend in unserem Lager, für die Arbeiten des Gatten interessirt, gibt sich beglückt, dankt für den „wunderschönen Abend“.
An Deutsch: telephonische Mitteilung: Wiedersehen bei Sacher beschlossen.
Eine „Zweierlege“!
To Mrs. Auredniček (express letter): I forward Oppel’s information!
From the tax authorities: tax mandate for 1932!
From Rinn (letter): crisis in all periodicals – deferment of publication (!?).
From UE (letter): they ask me to receive Dr. Roth and conductor Stein on Tuesday.
From 5 o’clock to 6:45, Mrs. van Hoboken: apparently in our camp, interested in her husband’s work, seems delighted, thanks us for the "wonderful evening."
To Deutsch, communication by telephone: rendezvous at the Sacher agreed.
A game of solitaire completed in two rounds!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 18, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Vorbereitung zum Diktat!
Um 5h vor dem Café bei Sacher ein Stündchen Kärntnerstraße.
Um 6h Deutsch, dann Frau van Hoboken! Verlasse sie früher wegen zu großer Wärme im Lokal.
Preparation for dictation!
At 5 o’clock, before coffee at the Sacher, an hour or so along the Kärntnerstraße.
At 6 o’clock, Deutsch; then Mrs. van Hoboken! We leave early, on account of the uncomfortably warm temperature in the café.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 19, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Frau Khuner (Br.): kommt Mittwoch zwischen 5–½6h.
Rf. während des Mittagstisches: Slecak singt Schuberts „Ständchen“, Backhaus spielt Brahms’ Paganini-Variationen (Platten!).
Nach der Jause Wege!

Unter den Gefallenen des Schutzchores February Uprising of 1934: the differences between the Social Democrats and the ruling Christian-Social party escalated between February 12 and 15 into civil war. The uprisings in factory workers’ barracks and council houses were crushed by military force. The war cost the Schutzbund almost 200 deaths and more than 300 wounded; the police suffered 128 deaths and 409 wounded. ist auch Josef Schiel, der Mann einer ehemaligen Hausgehilfin!!
Von Frau Auredniček (Br.): bittet mich um die Abschrift!!, wegen Ueberbürdung!!
Lie-Liechen schenkt der Paula u. Frau Mitzi Jansky ein Hemd!
¼7–¾7h Diktat!
From Mrs. Khuner (letter): she will come on Wednesday between 5 o’clock and 5:30.
Radio, during lunch: Slezak sings Schubert’s Ständchen, Backhaus plays Brahms’s Paganini Variations (records!).
After teatime, errands!
Josef Schiel is also among the casualties of the Schutzkorps – the husband of one of our previous housemaids!!
From Mrs. Auredniček (letter): asks me for a copy!!, on account of being overburdened!!
Lie-Liechen gives a blouse each to Paula and Mrs. Mitzi Jansky!
From 6:15 to 6:45, dictation!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 20, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von der U.-E.: S. 82.04 Tantieme.

Trauerfeier für die in der Abwehr des Aufruhrs Gefallenen. February Uprising of 1934: the differences between the Social Democrats and the ruling Christian-Social party escalated between February 12 and 15 into civil war. The uprisings in factory workers’ barracks and council houses were crushed by military force. The war cost the Schutzbund almost 200 deaths and more than 300 wounded; the police suffered 128 deaths and 409 wounded.
Von Oppel (Br.): unzufrieden mit den Zuständen.

Um ½6h Dr. Roth u. Kapellmeister Stein: unverzeihlich naiv! Der Verlag vertritt die Werke weder mit Geld noch mit Propaganda, erwartet das Heil nur vom Entgegenkommen einer Menschheit, der gut u. schlecht gleichgiltig ist. Ich bleibe bei meiner Auffassung.
Lie-Liechen behandelt meine körperlichen Beschwerden an Hand u. Füßen, Pedicüre usw.
Gute Nacht.
From UE: royalty payment of 82.04 shillings.
Memorial celebration for the fallen in the resistance to the insurgency.
From Oppel (letter): dissatisfaction with the conditions in Germany.

At 5:30, Dr. Roth and conductor Stein: unforgivably naive! The publisher is championing my works neither with money nor with publicity; it expects salvation only from the responsiveness of a humanity which cannot distinguish between good or bad. I stick to my understanding of the situation.
Lie-Liechen treats the physical discomforts in my hands and feet; pedicure, etc.
A good night.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 21, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Frau Khuner von ¼6–9h!!! Tut sehr interessirt – ladet sich selbst wieder ein!!!
Ich komme spät ins Bett – Lie-Liechen ist noch um ¼2h wach!

tei:div.tei:opener: 21, snow falls in clumps, for hours! +1°!

tei:ab.tei:seg: Mrs. Khuner from 5:15 to 9 o’clock!!! She behaves as if very interested – invites herself again!!!
I get to bed late – Lie-Liechen is still awake at 1:15!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 22, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von v. Hoboken als Drucksache zwei Hefte „Musikwissenschaft“.
Das Steuerbekenntnis für 1933 fertiggestellt.
From Hoboken, as printed papers, two issues of the Zeitschrift für Musikwissenschaft.
Tax declaration for 1933 completed.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 23, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Sophie (Br.): über unseren Zustand, Erkundigung nach Salos Befinden.

An die N. Fr. Presse (Br. rec.): S. 20 für den Dollfuß-Fond. After the February Uprising of 1934, the office of the Federal Chancellor organized a charitable fund on behalf of the "victims of the executive," and used the press to summon the public to contribute to it; see the Neue freie Presse, No. 24938, February 16, 1934, morning edition, p. 2.

An Doflein (K.): Dank für die Uebersendung des Programms;
         See diary entry for February 2, which records Schenker’s receipt of a program from the "Stadtseminar" in Freiburg im Breisgau. The term "Stadtseminar" presumably refers to the courses founded there by Erich Doflein in 1926 in music-theoretical training and general musical education for laymen.
         „der einzige heute gebotene 
 Rettungsdienst an der Musik.“
Nach der Jause in der Stadt: Schön!
To Sophie (letter): concerning our state of affairs, inquiry about Salo’s health.
To the Neue freie Presse (registered letter): 20 shillings for the Dollfuß Fund.

To Doflein (postcard): thanks for sending the program; "the only necessary
musical rescue service of today."
After teatime, in the city: very nice!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 24, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Frl. Elias bringt die Abschrift meines Aufsatzes für Frau Auredniček.
An Frau Auredniček den Aufsatzes Heinrich Schenker, Friedrich Smetana, Die Zukunft 4 (1893), pp. 37–40. recomm.
Sammlung der Aufsätze für v. Hoboken abgeschickt.
Miss Elias brings the copy of my article for Mrs. Auredniček.
To Mrs. Auredniček: the article sent by registered mail.
Collection of articles for Hoboken sent off.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 25, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An v. Hoboken (BegleitbriefOJ 89/7, [5]): über den Besuch der Frau v. H., Freude an seiner Weiterarbeit gegen „ Ganche; zu Schering.
Endlich an der Korrektur der letzten §§ zur Rhythmik u. Metrik in Der freie Satz.
Jause bei Sacher, kleiner Spaziergang.
Lese die Korrekturen, Lie-Liechen schreibt.
To Hoboken (covering letterOJ 89/7, [5]): concerning his wife’s visit, delight about his further work in opposition to Ganche; about Schering.
Finally, work on the corrections for the final paragraphs of "Rhythm" and "Meter" in Free Composition.
Afternoon snack at the Sacher, a short walk.
I read the corrections, Lie-Liechen writes.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 26, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von der DAZ: Mahnung!?!

Von der amtlichen deutschen Musikstelle „Amtliche Zeitschrift der Reichsmusikerschaft“ BriefOC 30/71: Einladung zu einem Aufsatz über die Urlinie u. Analyse. This letter is preserved in Schenker's Nachlass as OC 30/71: Friedrich Mahling to Schenker, February 23, 1934. Letterhead of Musik im Zeitbewusstsein, Fachverband B "Reichsmusikerschaft"/Amtliche Zeitschrift der Reichsmusikkammer.
Wege, – Lese, – Schreibe.
From the DAZ: reminder!?!
From the official German state music authority Amtliche Zeitschrift der Reichsmusikerschaft, letterOC 30/71: invitation to write an article about the Urlinie and analysis.
Errands – reading – writing.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 27, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Eine Teppichstopferin im Hause.
Nach der Jause Wege.
Lese – Lie-Liechen schreibt bis nach 12h die Metrik-Rhythmik in Der freie Satz fertig.
A carpet plugger in the house.
After teatime, errands.
Reading – Lie-Liechen finishes writing "Meter" and "Rhythm" for Free Composition after midnight.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 28, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Um 4h Floriz, nimmt die Jause mit uns – rät von einer Zusage nach Berlin ab See the diary entry for February 26; Schenker had received an invitation to write an essay about the Urlinie and his theory for the National-Socialist journal Musik im Zeitbewußtsein, the official organ of the "Reichsmusikerschaft," a branch of the state-controlled Reichsmusikkammer, which was established in November 1933. – sprechen über Breisach, Bamberger, Jonas usw.
At 4 o’clock, Floriz has afternoon snack with us – advises us against sending an acceptance to Berlin – we speak about Breisach, Bamberger, Jonas, etc.
